Package ui

Class UIManager

java.lang.Object
ui.UIManager
public class UIManager extends Object
Manages the user interface depending on the current state of the game. Contains methods to control different aspects of the UI. Should be instantianted in the main GamePanel object so that the objects within it can access this classes methods.
Author:
Jeffrey Jin (jjj9)
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • UIManager

      public UIManager(GamePanel gp)
      Constructs a UIManager object and links the Settings singleton to this class. Createds a UI array and fills it with each game screen. Reads the fullscreen setting from the configuration file.
      Parameters:
      gp - GamePanel object that is used to run the game

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Draws the user interface of the current game state onto the player's screen.
      Parameters:
      g2 - main graphics object used by gamePanel to draw the maps sprites and tiles

    • moveSelectorUp

      public void moveSelectorUp()
      Moves the user's selector up on the screen.

    • moveSelectorDown

      public void moveSelectorDown()
      Moves the user's selector down on the screen.

    • getSelectorPosition

      public int getSelectorPosition()
      Returns:
      the position of the selector

    • resetSelectorPosition

      public void resetSelectorPosition()
      Resets the postion of the selector to zero

    • getFullScreen

      public boolean getFullScreen()
      Returns:
      the status of full screen

    • setFullScreen

      public void setFullScreen(boolean fullScreen)
      Saves the status of full screen. Writes the status to the configuration file.
      Parameters:
      fullScreen - a boolean for the status of full screen

    • resetPlayScreen

      public void resetPlayScreen()
      Resets the player's timer and messages on the PlayScreen.

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String message)
      Draws the provided message onto the user's screen. Only runs if the player is in the game state play; otherwise does nothing.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be displayed on the screen

    • showNewHighScore

      public void showNewHighScore(boolean showHighScore)
      If player enters win or lose screen, show new high score message if player's score is higher than the saved score.
      Parameters:
      showHighScore - boolean value for whether if player's score is a new high score

    • getPlayTime

      public int getPlayTime()
      Returns:
      the player's play time from the play screen
